website_summaries.verdict: One of the best budget options available on the market.
pros: A lot of versatility with an affordable price tag
Can be used on roof and siding projects
A comfortable rubber grip promotes good ergonomics
cons: Might not handle larger professional roofing projects

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this nailer
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this was an obvious return from another unsatisfied customer.. It had an old coil nail still in the nail compartment. I'm glad I bought from Amazon- I returned it after a couple of test shots. I hated this nailer. Multiple shots on every trigger pull. I have many nail guns and they can all be finicky, but this was nearly impossible to control. I wound up using a Harbor Freight gun to do the job. It worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to shingle a patio cover. I didn't want to spend $250+ on a gun, I'm not a roofer. For my needs the nailer functioned admirably. I shot about 3000 nails, putting a few drops of oil in it at the beginning of each day I used it then a drop in occasionally when reloading. Very few misfires, mostly user error when it happened. Dropped it a couple times from 5'+, no issues. 100% satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.author: William Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good value, performs well
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight and functional gun, I'd say more aimed more for the do-it-yourselfers. I've used it for roofing a 20'x10' shed, and it held up very well. At too low, and too high of pressures it does have tendency to double shoot. Getting the pressure right at 90 psi seemed to take care of that problem. It feels solid in your hands, and performs well. My only complaint on the construction is the nail coil holder is lightweight plastic. A good drop, and that holder is likely toast.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this five stars. It was packaged well; the storage case is nice; it's solidly built; it works perfectly. The price point is justifiable even for smaller jobs. I'm not sure what else you could ask for. As with any nail gun, it does take a little getting used to for best technique. I did have a few double-strikes and a jamb, but I have to be honest and call it operator error. Jamb was very easy to clear. It's a quality tool and well worth the price for the time and effort savings over hand-nailing.
customer_reviews.author: NobodySpecial

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than three months.
customer_reviews.text: Had it just short of three months and it died in the middle of our project. Started shooting blanks (no nails coming out) for three or four times, then two nails would come out. Did that a few times, then completely quit putting any nails out without stopping after each nail and manually feeding the coil to the next nail. And of course it is past the return window for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best coil nailer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love Wen products. I haven't had a single one fail me. For those people dealing with double nailing issues, I believe it to be user error. This coil gun has made it through one 20 square roofing job already, without a single issue. It's a little heavy, but very durable and we'll constructed. It even has wear pads on the sides to avoid shingles/gun damage.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for value, but 4 stars really. ...
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for value, but 4 stars really. There is a depth adjustment which you MUST set and keep resetting about every bundle (no lock nut). Put about 25,000 nails through it without fail. Some double nails, but oh well. It finished the house, so way cheaper than renting a professional quality nail gun. Hope to re-roof the garage next summer and then garage-sale it or lend it out whenever.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Good gun
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this gun a few times. The biggest job being a roof on a 1300 sqr foot house along with a shed and chicken coop. Gun worked very good, no jambs to speak of. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy194

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool at a Great Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, this is the best gun. Light weight, does what it's designed for. Did a small roofing project, it cut down my time by hours. No more hand nailing. I have a nail gun, but this thing is better. Price was impeccable and this is my new favorite toy. Now on to another roofing job. I'm a WEN Fan!!!! No problems so far and I did a lot of nailing today.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton Scott

customer_reviews.title: You might be tempted, but your waisting your time with this one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nail gun knowing that it was cheap and probably wouldn't last me long. I only wanted it to shingle about 350sqft of roof. However, after about 100 sqft or 300'ish nails the claw that feeds the nails stopped feeding them. I was going to give it a one star rating but returning stuff on Amazon is easy. Even if you are shingling a small area, I would pass on this gun.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: a great affordable (large flat head nail) nailing gun
customer_reviews.text: Had a roofing repair/ replacement on my house.. much simpler and quicker to use a nail gun..This gun is light, works well (no jams) and was cheaper than hiring a roofing nailer from my local hardware.. I also used it with hot dipped galvanised nails to also do a fence. For the home DIY.. a great affordable (large flat head nail) nailing gun..
customer_reviews.author: Graham Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I used this to roof my garage as opposed to renting one, as I have more roofing to do and spending the extra money made sense. To be honest I didn't expect much from it as for a nail gun it is quite inexpensive but after doing the first job with it, I am thoroughly impressed. This thing performed all weekend long, never jammed and never double fired. I have no doubt that as long as I take care of it I wont have any issues with it at all. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Kampf

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This nailer did a good job on a recent small project after I got used to it. It initially double nailed often, but once I got the hang of the trigger, it happened less often. I had one jam that was easily cleared. I'm sure there are better nailers out there, but not at this price.
customer_reviews.author: jason hine

customer_reviews.title: WEN nailed it.
customer_reviews.text: Used for 3 months now and no problems. A double nail once in a great while, but you get that with all nailers . For the money, you really can't go wrong. If youre just buying one for 1 or 2 projects, you'd be foolish to spend more on a "better" one. This one works great and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Double fires a ton, but works ok
customer_reviews.text: Double fires likes CRAZY if you just put it down and pull the trigger. Works much better just holding the trigger down and bump firing it. Fired about 1,000 nails so far and it's pretty decent other than the double fires.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Harrison III

customer_reviews.title: Good gun Good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a roofer but in my business I do need a roofing nailer from time to time. To date the Wen nail gun has gone through about 7500 nails with no problems other than double shooting nails maybe three or four times. For the $85 it has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: M.Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Jams, double shoots.
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating. Even for small jobs it double shoots and jams constantly. Don't be like me and think you'll save money because you will only use it a few times. Now I have to buy a real coil nailer to finish my fence.
customer_reviews.author: D. belhumeur

customer_reviews.title: Another hit from WEN
customer_reviews.text: i have been quite impressed with wen products and I recently purchased this to reshingle my carport roof. It was moderately easy to load and super easy to use. I shot over 2000 nails without issue. It comes in a nice case and includes tool oil, adjustment wrenches, etc. An amazing gun for the price and I really can't see needing anything more than this for my occasional roofing needs! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Roy CoxTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for home owner. Nice case.
customer_reviews.text: I had to redo a portion of roof. Last time i borrowed a gun but i could not this time. Amazon saved the day and delivered it in time for the weekend. Gun works well. I also like that it came with a flask of oil and a hard case so i can now store it safely until next time i need it.
customer_reviews.author: Francois Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built
customer_reviews.text: The thing is heavy, but seems very solid. I've been using it on a workshop roof DIY, and it never missed a beat. Appears to be a good tool at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Trapshooter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Terrible , I give it 2 stars because I finsihed roofing my shed and it helped but that double firing everyone is talking about is real every 1 in 8 nails and in being nice. I think I double fired a total of a whole coil...I will reach out to wen to see if maybe this is defective...but stay away u get what u pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Menechella

customer_reviews.title: This tool works well.  Good value and will do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I just roofed a lean to with this tool. I went through 11 packs of 3 tab shingles. It never misfired. The only time there was a problem is when I doubled bumped. Keep it oiled and I bet this nailer will go for a long time. Big fan!! Save money and do it yourself. Mind you, it is tough work. Respect someone when you meet them and they are a drywall person, or a roofer, or a concrete person, or a carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Ondracek

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for a small addition.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional but my experience with this nail gun was great. It worked perfectly for a 10 x 12 addition. I even used it some for some siding. Not a single jam or misfire.
customer_reviews.author: .33 TPI

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value!
customer_reviews.text: DIY Roofing project, 41 bundles of shingles. I went back and forth on buying such a specialized tool that I may not use for anther 30 years. However, after spending a couple hours on the roof $80 is an incredible value for this product. Only cons were an occasional double fire which could be user error, and the dept gauge needs to be adjusted frequently from vibration it seems to move. Not having to swing a hammer and the time saved made up for these cons and then some. Also make sure to use the oil which is included before each use.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Fast accurate placement of nails for re-shingling our carport and workshop. My husband loves that it comes complete with a case so all the parts can be kept neatly organized. This is a real time saver compared to hammering the nails into the shingles. We love it!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: NAILER
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Good product for value. Went thru 20 square of shingle without a hiccup. Second Wen nailer purchased both good values.
customer_reviews.author: Jn Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: The Price Is Right
customer_reviews.text: Generally works well. No jams, but an occasional double nails. Probably due to how I am using it (place and pull trigger). I have plenty of nails.
customer_reviews.author: JDL

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad nail gun for the money, but really likes to shoot two nails on a single trigger pull. Not overly impressed I would save up and get a better on though. This would be possibly acceptable as a back up though.
customer_reviews.author: TotallyNotAWerewolf

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and for a very low price. I roofed a medium sized chicken coop. No issues. No jams. I look forward to using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my shed project
customer_reviews.text: I only used it for a 7x16 shed roof, but it worked great. It seems well made, and the price was right. I'd recommend this for DIY projects, I don't know how it would hold up using it as a professional roofer would.
customer_reviews.author: BigConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: My first experience using a roofing nailer. I had one big job to do and then wouldn't be using it much afterwards. The only reason I bought this was it made sense when compared to renting one for a few days. For the money it seems to be a decent nailer. My only complaint is that it has a tendency to bend the nail heads a bit. I'm assuming that more expensive nailers wouldn't do this. I found myself having to reach for my hammer often to flatten out the heads. Other than that minor issue it worked great. For occasional use and then put away, it is a great way to go.
customer_reviews.author: u6stringu

customer_reviews.title: Did a great job
customer_reviews.text: I roofed my Garage with 17 sq of shingles using this gun---with no misfires ---or jams----worked great.... Excellent Gun for this amount of money-----very satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: karen hollar

customer_reviews.title: Loved this nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Loved this nail gun! The project took a lot longer than expected, so renting one would have cost a small fortune. This gun completed the job of re-roofing a large house and detached garage with absolutely no problems. It was well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: but not without a lot of stops and starts and wasted nails. I really like the coil feeder system ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a one job nailer. Inexpensive, will work for a while. Misfires a lot. It got the job done, but not without a lot of stops and starts and wasted nails. I really like the coil feeder system but would have bought a much more expensive gun if I had to work with this extensively.
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: WOW what a value
customer_reviews.text: Incredible price for an incredible tool. Came with a nice case, safety glasses, oil, and misc tools for maintenance. Worked flawlessly and tirelessly on my project. Best 80 bucks I have spent in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Onley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a back saver. Not sure how would hold up for every day use. But worked great. I got some double hits. But once I got the hang of it was ok. Loving Wen products.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price. Great product. For a DIY project it was the perfect tool. I shingled my new garage. This gun saved me tons of time. Highly recommend worked perfectly for my project
customer_reviews.author: C. Conkey

customer_reviews.title: Red and black one
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything except the depth adjustment wouldn't stay adjusted. Needs a set screw to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great value
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Nails never got caught. I dropped it and it was fine. That’s a plus in my book. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was a a little on the heavy side. However very dependable, no jamming, dependable. I would recommend purchasing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ced

customer_reviews.title: Performed wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time today, and it performed well. It had a couple of double fires, but no harm done. I've been doing some roof repairs, and used a hammer on the previous two iterations. This time, I used the nailer, and it was dramatically easier. I can't speak to how well it'll perform over time.
customer_reviews.author: Br

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Did my entire roof without a single issue. Can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: ... nail gun re shingle my 3000sq ft roof works great. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I have used this nail gun re shingle my 3000sq ft roof works great. I would buy it again. not very heavy and just works great.
customer_reviews.author: coldfun

customer_reviews.title: Great gun
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a champ. I replaced two roofs this fall and never had an issue - if you are not a professional roofer but want a great low priced tool - this is the one for you. Saved us countless hours.
customer_reviews.author: tim nemechek

customer_reviews.title: Functions Great !!
customer_reviews.text: This nailer worked great. It was easy to load and to use. I had no problems. It seems to be well built. At half the cost of brand name nailers, I would recommend this nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L. Keene, CPA

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for roofing and hardie siding, works great. only down side is I get more double fires then I would like but sure beats hand nailing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My husband seems to be very happy with this product and that says a lot cuz he uses a lot of tools
customer_reviews.author: shawna middleton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. I would recommend this to anyone.bought all my nails from Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Read the review's and was pleasantly surprised at how well ...
customer_reviews.text: Read the review's and was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked for the money. It never missed a beat. I can see the comments now about the depth adjustment it does move.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Soukup

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my rental house. Bought two and we knocked it out in no time. I’m not professional so this won’t be used that often. I was able to replace my roof without spending thousands to pay someone. Please with product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used to shingle replacement roof. Worked great and saved a bunch of time. For the handy man who does not us it full time it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Leo D.

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools i ever bought for the money. Did countless roofs with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to load and it is not heavy
customer_reviews.text: This gun worked very well. I used it to put down 7 bundles of shingles. Yes, I had a few double nail hits but overall for the price it is difficult to beat. It is easy to load and it is not heavy. I don't know how well it will hold up over time but for a few projects around the house it should do a really nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Only needed it to last long enough to shingle my garage. Held up great and only jammed once.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all. For a lower end gun it has been flawless. Have used it for 2 roofs and no issues, saved me may a mashed finger already
customer_reviews.author: quilt lover

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: At least 1 in 10 nails malfunctions in some way, but since it's a cheap gun, that's no different than what I expected. Definitely would not recommend for a full-time roofer as these malfunctions cost a fair bit of time overall. However, for the price, I think it's more worth it than a nicer gun of you don't plan on using it too much.
customer_reviews.author: cdavis

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home user.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this nail gun to replace around 300 square feet of asphalt shingles. It was easy to load the nails and it worked perfectly. While I could have rented a professional one for the 2 days I needed it the cost would have been the same and now I have it for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Willard

customer_reviews.title: thread lock
customer_reviews.text: it works great but when i tried to change out the Couplers it has thread lock on it so i can't remove the end to put on a hook so i dont have to hold on to the nail gun all the time or on the roof. other than that works great. i will buy again. if needed
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be a quality made tool and may work better with regular roofing nails but I had to return ...
customer_reviews.text: This gun would not shoot 13/4" ring shank siding nails reliably. It appears to be a quality made tool and may work better with regular roofing nails but I had to return it and get another more expensive gun to get my job done. Amazon customer service was perfect as usual.
customer_reviews.author: S. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use out of the box
customer_reviews.text: First nail gun, not a professional. Very easy to use out of the box. No jams after shooting several shingles and lumber. Bought because of good reviews compared to harbor and freight for entry level guns
customer_reviews.author: K. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Use on Florida Room roof
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Use on Florida Room roof. 1875 nails no issue at all . Every other refill on nails I put a few drops of oil to keep it lubricated. Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: James M Connolly

customer_reviews.title: good value for great price
customer_reviews.text: it held up well for 3 days straight of roofing. so far its done very well for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: sms

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for re-roofing a 1640 sq foot barn
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for re-roofing a 1640 sq foot barn. Tended tom double fire quite a bit; but that may be operator error and not the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: It did the job but does do a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: It did the job but does do a lot of double shots. Kind of a pain when you go for 1 nail and end up with 2 or 3.
customer_reviews.author: doing good

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a porch roof. we went through a few hundred nails without a single jam.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. A few double shots but that was probably me getting used to the product.
customer_reviews.author: kevin cloud

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I just received it and tried it out on some scrap wood. It shot 1 1/4" nail into pressure treated 2*4 with no problem at 90 psi so should work good on sheathing with the depth adjustment. Does seems to misfire at the lower 70psi but I just won't set it down that low when I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to re-roof the back part of my house. It was a medium sized project and worked great! I would highly recommend for the price. Perhaps a more expensive one could have been better, but this definitely did the job. It was easy to use and did what it says. I've only used it on this one job so can't vouch for the life expectancy, but worked perfectly for the one job.
customer_reviews.author: Ronden

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for my purposes. It does have a hair trigger and double shot of nails is really easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: mkjprice

customer_reviews.title: 2 triggers
customer_reviews.text: I should have changed the trigger , I got a lot of double tap. I would buy this again. But I wont need to, works great.
customer_reviews.author: T Bucukle

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Purchased two to put a new roof on our house. They ran flawless. We ran both at 90 psi all weekend with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's good. For small simple jobs it does the job
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Economical roofing nailer
customer_reviews.text: This roofing gun was easy to set up for the nail length, easy to load and use. A bit heavier than a Hitachi my working partner used, but half the cost and performed every bit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M.

customer_reviews.title: ... reroofing my garage and shed with this and worked great! Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Completed reroofing my garage and shed with this and worked great! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tri-Rino Jim

customer_reviews.title: Wen roofing nail gun
customer_reviews.text: I built a new garage and purchased the Wen roofing nailer to lay down new shingles. Once I figured out how to adjust the nail coil container on the gun it worked very well. 8 square, no jams.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Byrne Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not Magnesium body
customer_reviews.text: Item description says light magesium housing. That is a total lie. It's die cast aluminum. I attached a picture off the box.
customer_reviews.author: paul s

customer_reviews.title: Worked with no problems reroofing a 3200 sf house.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished reroofing my 3200 sf single story house. Nailer worked with no problems. Well worth the purchase. Probably never use it again, I hope any way.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace in Santa Rosa

customer_reviews.title: When not operated because of piston part
customer_reviews.text: Where can i buy spare parts (o ring 61782b-018, piston assy 61782b-019,etc..) when they are broken or banded
customer_reviews.author: Cho hyo hyun

customer_reviews.title: Works great! What else can I say
customer_reviews.text: Works great! What else can I say. I shingled my roof over the weekend never had a nail jam worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Nice gun, Works well
customer_reviews.text: What can i say, it does a really good job.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with This Tool !
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to load, worked for me every time. I had a small job and couldn't justify a higher quality model (and didn't need it). I loaded this baby up and shot about 600 nails without a jam or failure. I double shot it a few times, but that was my fault. I would buy it again. And the shipping was on time and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: J. Culver

customer_reviews.title: got it on time nice unit works well on
customer_reviews.text: got it on time nice unit works well on .120nails. have some problem driving sometimes drive two nails but with care we will worh it out. the took box latch came in broken but did not feel it was worth making a fuss. so far happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: kareng44

customer_reviews.title: Forget the Chinese junk; get a used Japanese Hitachi...
customer_reviews.text: Too many multi-fires!!! 2, 3, and 4 nails at a time!! Not worth it! Buy a used Hitachi NV45AB2 on e bay. SOOOOO much better! I'm no pro; just a very handy DIY-er trying to save money and get the best value I have a WEN 18 gauge trim nailer, which works great. Thought their roofing nailer would be the same -- it is definitely not! Ended up buying a well-used Hitachi roofing gun on e - bay. It never multi-fires, and just works. Plus, parts are well available. Do what you want, but save yourself some time and aggravation and get what the pro-roofers use -- Hitachi or Bostich. Anyhow, that's my take on it.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with the price and it's not one of those "you get what you pay for" deals. It's actually great quality. It came in a nice case with safety glasses. My husband needed it in a pinch and it's worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Meaghen N Arbour

customer_reviews.title: This worked well for my 220' fencing project.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for my 220' fencing project. Drove about 8000 nails with it.
customer_reviews.author: DaBuick

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works good for the price. Maybe not for a full time roofer, but for home owner it's a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: David Turner

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a month or so but it works great.
customer_reviews.text: only had it for a month or so but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: uncle mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Not enough words to describe how great this product is. Used to do a roof and never jammed once. I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend money on quailty of gun forget the supplied case!
customer_reviews.text: Multiple shots on every trigger pull the first day, second day okay, third day jams unable to remove nail for fear of damaging the gun. the gun was oiled daily. Disappointed I had to purchase another brand of gun.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: After reading reviews I purchased a total of five of ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I purchased a total of five of these nail guns. Seamed to perform well. Men did complain of the weight of the gun by end of day. Mid morning today a gun fired while laying on the roof when the workman was being handed another bundle of shingles. Thank goodness the nail hit him in the wrist and not into the head/face. Yes, he is at the ER having a nail pulled from his outer wrist bone. The five guns will be scrapped.
customer_reviews.author: JSUltra2011

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is great for the DIY person! Finished my roof with ease. Can't beat the price and worked like a charm. As long as you have the pressure right and have nails in the gun, it works as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Worked flawlessly on 500sq ft of roof with ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Worked flawlessly on 500sq ft of roof with 1.25" nails. Makes shingling so fast!!!
customer_reviews.author: Permian

customer_reviews.title: Shoots two nails most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I was very frustrated because I couldn't get the nail gun to shoot just one nail. Double shot almost every other time. Sometimes it would shoot three nails. I am not a professional roofer, just doing a large shed. Never figured out how to avoid the double shot.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Atchley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Rapid fire trigger, really fires fast!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far, used to re roof a shed. Only miss fired about 8 times, out of 6 coils. Not a bad gun at all, great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to do my own roof. Worked great. Can't speak to long term or daily use but was perfect for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no issues. Had it up and running in less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Why rent when you can buy?
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ, even despite two falls from the roof! Well worth it to avoid the cost of a commercial pneumatic coil rental.
customer_reviews.author: j me

customer_reviews.title: great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: A little touchy on the trigger and had a few double taps...just need to get use to the trigger..... great tool for the price. No issue yet and used it side and roof a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Bad for siding
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on siding. Returned for full refund thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Barth

customer_reviews.title: Overall felt like a quality build
customer_reviews.text: Overall felt like a quality build. Throughout a 20'x4' roof project, I struggled with "double nailing." No amount of adjustment or trigger sensitivity would correct the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

product_meta.title: WEN 61783 3/4-Inch to 1-3/4-Inch Pneumatic Coil Roofing Nailer
product_meta.description: Size:Black CaseRemember when you could re-roof your roof? Nail shingles, insulation boards, waterproof tar paper, fiber cement roofing, siding, vinyl and more with the WEN Pneumatic Coil Roofing Nailer. The versatile magazine holds up to 120 nails at a time, allowing for sizes of 11-gauge (.12 inches) nails ranging from 3/4 of an inch all the way up to 1-3/4 of an inch. Adjust the depth of the fired nails by turning the depth-setting wheel found on the head of the nailer. Clear jammed nails with the quick-release compartment on the side of the magazine. The adjustable shingle guide easily slides up and down the bottom of the magazine to help with quick and easy spacing for shingles of any size. This powerful nailer provides up to 430-inch-pounds of force at a 100 PSI operating pressure, making sure your siding stays in place. The rubber grip handle helps limit fatigue and maximize comfort during long jobs while the turnable exhaust valve on top of the nailer lets users aim the direction of the output air. With a 1/4-inch NPT air inlet, drive fasteners using pneumatic pressure anywhere from 70 to 120 PSI. This package also includes a bottle of oil, three assorted hex wrenches and a convenient blow-mold carrying case for easily transporting your nailer. And, because its a WEN product, your coil roofing nailer comes backed by a one-year warranty and a friendly customer phone line all to make sure you remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Fire 11-gauge nails (.12 inches) anywhere from 3/4 to 1-3/4 of an inch
Adjustable shingle guide and depth control makes for easy shingle spacing during jobs
Holds up to 120 nails at a time with a quick release for easily fixing jams
Uses pneumatic operating pressure anywhere from 70 to 120 PSI
Includes a blow mold carrying case, oil, and hex wrenches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars289 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
